verses.verse: And again He began to be teaching along the sea. And a great crowd was gathered together close to Him in such a way that for Him to be sitting in the sea He climbed on board into the boat. And the entire crowd was on the land close to the sea.
And He was teaching them many things in illustrations. And He was saying to them in His teaching,
"Listen. Look. The person who seeds went out to seed.
And it happened during the time to be seeding; one that fell along the road, and the winged birds of the sky came and ate it.
Another fell on the rocky place where it did not have much soil, and right away it came up because of the fact for it not to be having depth of soil.
When the sun ascended, it was scorched, and because of the fact for it not to be having root, it shriveled up.
And another fell into the thorns. And the thorns climbed up, came together, and choked it off. And it did not give fruit.
And another fell into the soil, the nice soil, and was giving fruit as it was climbing up and growing. And one was carrying thirty, one sixty, and one a hundred."
And He was saying to them, "The person who has ears to be listening must listen."
And when He became in places where they were alone, the people around Him together with the Twelve asked Him about the illustration.
And He was saying to them, "It has been given to you to know the secret of the empire of God, but to those people outside all things are happening in illustrations
so that as they look, they may look and not see, and as they hear, they may hear and not understand. They will never return back, and it (the sins) be forgiven them."
And He says to them, "Don't you realize this illustration? And how will you know all the illustrations?
The person who seeds, seeds the message.
These are the people along the road where the message is seeded. And when they hear, right away the Opponent comes and takes away the message, the one that has been seeded in their hearts.
And these likewise are the people seeded on the rocky places, who, when they hear the message, right away with happiness they take it.
And they don't have root in themselves, but they are for the time being. After that, when hard times or persecution happens because of the message, right away they are tripped.
And these are the people seeded into the thorns, the people who heard the message,

and the worries of this span of time, the fraud of the wealth, and the desires concerning the rest of the things, as they travel into them, come together and choke off the message. And they become fruitless.
And these are the people seeded on the soil, the nice soil, any who hear the message and accept it with a warm welcome. And they produce fruit, one thirty, one sixty, and one a hundred."

And He was saying to them, "The lamp doesn't come into a room so that it might be placed under the two gallon measuring bowl or under the cot, does it? No, it comes into a room so that it might be placed on the lampstand.
You see, something is not hidden if it is not a thing that might be shown, neither did it become hidden away, but so that it might come into a shown place.
If anyone has ears to be listening, he must listen."
And He was saying to them, "Look out what you listen to. With the measurement that you measure, it will be measured to you, and it will be added to you, the people who listen.
You see, whoever has, it will be given to him. And a person who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him."
And He was saying, "The empire of God is like this, as if a person would throw the batch of seeds on the ground.
And he may sleep and get up night and day, and the batch of seeds may bud and get longer. How? He does not know.
You see, the earth automatically produces fruit, first vegetation, after that a head of grain, after that full grain in the head.
But when the fruit turns up, right away he sends out the sickle because the harvest has offered itself."
And He was saying, "What will we liken the empire of God to? Or in what kind of illustration will we illustrate it?
It is as a kernel of mustard, that, when it is seeded on the earth, it is a seed littler than all the seeds, the seeds on the earth.

And when it is seeded, it climbs up and becomes greater than all the vegetables. And it makes huge branches in such a way for the winged birds of the sky to be able to be bedding down under its shadow."
And with many of these types of illustrations, He was speaking the message to them, just what they were able to be hearing.
Without an illustration, He was not speaking to them. But by themselves to His students, He was explaining everything.
And He says to them during that day when it becomes evening, "We will go across to the other side."
And after leaving the crowd, they take Him along as He was in the boat. There were also other small boats with Him.
And a huge sudden burst of wind happens. The swells were tossing over into the boat in such a way for it to already be full.
And He was on the back of the boat on the cushion sleeping. And they wake Him up and say to Him, "Teacher, isn't it a concern to You that we are being ruined?"
And when He was wide awake, He forbid the wind and said to the sea, "Silence. Be quiet." And the wind died down, and there became a huge calm.
And He said to them, "Why are you cowardly like this? How is it that you do not have trust?"
And they were afraid with huge fear and were saying to each other, "Who is this Person, then, because even the wind and the sea obey Him?"
